Description: Lower body sherd with low conical foot of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (mostly worn leaving white slip underneath visible) with two or more added white bands; exterior: below handle zone, part of broken maeander frieze; below, rising rays between pairs of bands; top of foot resrved, rest streakily glazed; inscription on underside of foot.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs in the Chalice style, however, the handle zone, which is more pronounced than on typical Chalice Style chalices, would be more appropriately placed in the Wild Goat Style. The decoration on the cul, consisting of rising rays is not typical of the Chalice Style either, but is common in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 171, no. 63)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1100)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0163) (phase 2)
